name: apis
description: The API object describes an API thatâ€™s being exposed by Kong. Kong needs to know how to retrieve the API when a consumer is calling it from the Proxy port. Each API object must specify some combination of hosts, uris, and methods. Kong will proxy all requests to the API to the specified upstream URL.

fields.name: hosts
fields.help: A comma-separated list of domain names that point to your API. For example: example.com. At least one of hosts, uris, or methods should be specified.

fields.name: uris
fields.help: A comma-separated list of URIs prefixes that point to your API. For example: /my-path. At least one of hosts, uris, or methods should be specified.

fields.name: methods
fields.help: A comma-separated list of URIs prefixes that point to your API. For example: /my-path. At least one of hosts, uris, or methods should be specified.

fields.name: upstream_url
fields.help: The base target URL that points to your API server. This URL will be used for proxying requests. For example: https://example.com.

fields.name: strip_uri
fields.help: When matching an API via one of the uris prefixes, strip that matching prefix from the upstream URI to be requested. Default: true.

fields.name: preserve_host
fields.help: When matching an API via one of the hosts domain names, make sure the request Host header is forwarded to the upstream service. By default, this is false, and the upstream Host header will be extracted from the configured upstream_url.

fields.name: retries
fields.help: The number of retries to execute upon failure to proxy. The default is 5.

fields.name: upstream_connect_timeout
fields.help: The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection to your upstream service. Defaults to 60000.

fields.name: upstream_send_timeout
fields.help: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive write operations for transmitting a request to your upstream service Defaults to 60000.

fields.name: upstream_read_timeout
fields.help: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive read operations for transmitting a request to your upstream service Defaults to 60000.

fields.name: https_only
fields.help: To be enabled if you wish to only serve an API through HTTPS, on the appropriate port (8443 by default). Default: false.

fields.name: http_if_terminated
fields.help: Consider the X-Forwarded-Proto header when enforcing HTTPS only traffic. Default: false.
